result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J. Scherer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must complete Probation with no early termination.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

No contact with the co-defendant. No contact with the victim without the victim's and Agent's consent - EXCEPT parties may have contact through employment.
----------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATIONS OF PROBATION WHATSOEVER, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: The defendant must complete a total of thirty (30) hours community service work during his term of probation with NO BUYOUT.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph J. Scherer in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Rebecca Hammock
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.L.. NO PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION. NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR KEVIN KECKHAVER.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Joseph J. Scherer appeared, Haley Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
